verses.text: Moreover take thou \w up|strong="H5375"\w* a \w lamentation|strong="H7015"\w* for the \w princes|strong="H5387"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*,

And \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, What \add is\add* thy \w mother|strong="H0517"\w*? A \w lioness|strong="H3833"\w*: she lay \w down|strong="H7257"\w* among \w lions|strong="H0738"\w*, she \w nourished|strong="H7235"\w* her \w whelps|strong="H1482"\w* \w among|strong="H8432"\w* young \w lions|strong="H3715"\w*.

And she brought \w up|strong="H5927"\w* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* of her \w whelps|strong="H1482"\w*: it became a young \w lion|strong="H3715"\w*, and it \w learned|strong="H3925"\w* to \w catch|strong="H2963"\w* the \w prey|strong="H2964"\w*; it \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w* \w men|strong="H0120"\w*.

The \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* also \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* of him; he was \w taken|strong="H8610"\w* in their \w pit|strong="H7845"\w*, and they \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* him with \w chains|strong="H2397"\w* unto the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*.

Now when she \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that she had \w waited|strong="H3176"\w*, \add and\add* her \w hope|strong="H8615"\w* was \w lost|strong="H0006"\w*, then she \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w another|strong="H0259"\w* of her \w whelps|strong="H1482"\w*, \add and\add* \w made|strong="H7760"\w* him a young \w lion|strong="H3715"\w*.

And he went up and \w down|strong="H1980"\w* \w among|strong="H8432"\w* the \w lions|strong="H0738"\w*, he became a young \w lion|strong="H3715"\w*, and \w learned|strong="H3925"\w* to \w catch|strong="H2963"\w* the \w prey|strong="H2964"\w*, \add and\add* \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w* \w men|strong="H0120"\w*.

And he \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* their desolate \w palaces|strong="H0490"\w*, and he laid \w waste|strong="H2717"\w* their \w cities|strong="H5892"\w*; and the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* was \w desolate|strong="H3456"\w*, and the \w fulness|strong="H4393"\w* thereof, by the \w noise|strong="H6963"\w* of his \w roaring|strong="H7581"\w*.\f + \fr 19.7 \ft their desolate…: or, their widows\f*\f + \fr 19.7 \ft the fulness…: or, all it containeth\f*

Then the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* \w set|strong="H5414"\w* against him on every \w side|strong="H5439"\w* from the \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w*, and \w spread|strong="H6566"\w* their \w net|strong="H7568"\w* over him: he was \w taken|strong="H8610"\w* in their \w pit|strong="H7845"\w*.

And they \w put|strong="H5414"\w* him in \w ward|strong="H5474"\w* in \w chains|strong="H2397"\w*, and \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* him to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*: they \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* him into \w holds|strong="H4685"\w*, that his \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* should no more be \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* upon the \w mountains|strong="H2022"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.\f + \fr 19.9 \ft in chains: or, in hooks\f*

¶ Thy \w mother|strong="H0517"\w* \add is\add* like a \w vine|strong="H1612"\w* in thy \w blood|strong="H1818"\w*, \w planted|strong="H8362"\w* by the \w waters|strong="H4325"\w*: she was \w fruitful|strong="H6509"\w* and full of \w branches|strong="H6058"\w* by reason of \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w*.\f + \fr 19.10 \ft in…: or, in thy quietness, or, in thy likeness\f*

And she had \w strong|strong="H5797"\w* \w rods|strong="H4294"\w* for the \w sceptres|strong="H7626"\w* of them that bare \w rule|strong="H4910"\w*, and her \w stature|strong="H6967"\w* was \w exalted|strong="H1361"\w* among the thick \w branches|strong="H5688"\w*, and she \w appeared|strong="H7200"\w* in her \w height|strong="H1363"\w* with the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of her \w branches|strong="H1808"\w*.

But she was plucked \w up|strong="H5428"\w* in \w fury|strong="H2534"\w*, she was cast \w down|strong="H7993"\w* to the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*, and the \w east|strong="H6921"\w* \w wind|strong="H7307"\w* dried \w up|strong="H3001"\w* her \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w*: her \w strong|strong="H5797"\w* \w rods|strong="H4294"\w* were \w broken|strong="H6561"\w* and \w withered|strong="H3001"\w*; the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* \w consumed|strong="H0398"\w* them.
And now she \add is\add* \w planted|strong="H8362"\w* in the \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*, in a \w dry|strong="H6723"\w* and \w thirsty|strong="H6772"\w* \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*.

And \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* is gone \w out|strong="H3318"\w* of a \w rod|strong="H4294"\w* of her \w branches|strong="H0905"\w*, \add which\add* hath \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w* her \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w*, so that she hath no \w strong|strong="H5797"\w* \w rod|strong="H4294"\w* \add to be\add* a \w sceptre|strong="H7626"\w* to \w rule|strong="H4910"\w*. This \add is\add* a \w lamentation|strong="H7015"\w*, and shall be for a \w lamentation|strong="H7015"\w*.
